entry.title: [AsyncSB] Consolidate pre-commit and post-commit blocking page into one function
entry.content:
With async SB check, the function

SafeBrowsingUIManager::CreateBlockingPageForSubresource will no longer

be accurate because blocking page on the mainframe URL can also

be created from this code path. This CL simplifies the code by

combining the creation of pre-commit blocking page (from

SafeBrowsingNavigationThrottle::WillFailRequest) and post-commit

blocking page (from BaseUIManager::DisplayBlockingPage) into

one function.



Enterprise real-time check always delays main page load, so it is

impossible that a post-commit blocking page has

SB_THREAT_TYPE_MANAGED_POLICY_WARN or

SB_THREAT_TYPE_MANAGED_POLICY_BLOCK as its threat type. Therefore, this

CL doesn't have behavioral change.



Bug: 1501194

Change-Id: I6f6dc81cf0da2e3cc114b691e8a1822a2fbb374b

entry.title: Restore test by running it in a VTS
entry.content:
The requestAnimationFrame throttling test flakes as the number of rAFs

counted by the test is prolonged by placing the frame doing the counting

in a separate process than the frame making the decision about the

throttling.



This CL tries to avoid losing the test coverage by placing the affected

test into a virtual test suite (VTS) that disables the cross-process

behavior. The test will be exclusive to the VTS, and so the

TestExpectations entry can be removed.



Bug: 1515794, 510122

entry.title: Remove kWebAppEnableScopeExtensions feature flag check for origin flash
entry.content:
The removed flag cannot be enabled easily at runtime for origin trial.

Instead of checking the feature flag, check the presence of scope

extensions entries in the displayed web app to achieve a similar effect.



New behavior:

- When the feature is disabled, apps will show the static origin text.

(Same as before)

- When the feature is enabled but the app does not use scope_extensions,

show the static origin text. (Different)

- When the feature is enabled and app uses scope_extensions, show the

dynamic origin text.



(Static origin text -> origin text formatted from start URL.)

entry.title: [BreakoutBox] Do not require a sink signal to do eager conversion
entry.content:
MediaStreamVideoTrackUnderlyingSink tries to convert RGB frames to NV12

if it has observed a signal from sinks requesting GMB-backed frames.

In practice, this occurs when a WebRTC sink wants to use hardware

encoding.



We have observed that the signal usually arrives after some RGB frames

have been sent to the sink and it has fallen back to software encoding,

making the conversions useless.



This CL:

* Enables the conversion without waiting for the signal, similar to

how canvas capture does it.

* Adds a kill switch for enabling conversion without signal.

* Makes getting the GMB manager synchronous, even if running outside

the main thread.

* Rewrites the condition for eager format conversion so that it is

easier to read.



Bug: 1519558

Change-Id: Idc953d9569f2252615a3b9ea99a8f0171db0bf31

entry.title: [ios] Dont show suggestions with no username on single username form
entry.content:
Related to: go/bling-signin-uff-prd



This is to mitigate the cases where there is no username to be filled

in the single username form (as highlighted in the prd:

http://shortn/_s1WO18oJeO).



The logic here only applies to the username form in UFF. The

single password form is untouched.



Having suggestion with no option to fill a username feels broken and

isn't a great user experience.



Also, the keyboard accessory should fallback to Autofill suggestions

to at least suggest email addresses when there is no username

available in the stored credentials.



This means the check suggestions query should return false if the

only available credentials are empty usernames with no value.



No suggestions are returned if all the usernames are empty (it is

theoretically possible to only have one empty username but it is

good to handle multiple just in case).



If there is an empty username along other non-empty usernames, the

empty username is still part of the suggestions to keep the

suggestions consistent across the username and password forms in the

sign-in uff flow.



Implementation validation slides: http://shortn/_PCi5dD4PLR

> We've discussed details and decided to show empty usernames when

there are other available usernames in the suggestions.



Gated behind the kIOSPasswordSignInUff flag where it will be

co-launched with sign-in uff feature.



Bug: b/320291554

entry.title: Use PWM::FormDataParser predictions to perform similarity check.
entry.content:
This CL modifies the similarity check that is performed between the

cached form and the focused form when deciding whether to attempt

showing a bottomsheet.



The logic contained in this CL uses password_manager::FormDataParser

predictions to determine similarity: The two forms are similar iff

the fields predicted by FormDataParser as username and password fields

are identical.



For non-password forms this check would work poorly, but currently

prefill requests are sent exclusively for login forms.



The changes in the code are guarded behind a flag.



Bug: 1513847

Change-Id: Idd3108b12432d80fd0c26702d9c557e2003324b8

entry.title: Revert "Reland^2 "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7ce33d14425dd41749c33cf86602ef246185d657.



Reason for revert: More bot failures:

* chromium-internal-arm64-builder-rel

* chromium-internal-arm-builder-rel

* arm64-unpublished-builder-rel

* arm64-builder-rel



Original change's description:

> Reland^2 "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default"

>

> This reverts commit df45839bc319c8101f8217255db75229b0f7d8cc.

>

> Reason for reland: android-binary-size-generator now has PGO profiles,

> and this change now updates static initializer logic.

>

> Original change's description:

> > android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default

> >

> > The most popular arm64 builds (Trichrome) are shipping with

> > is_high_end_android. The Monochrome arm64 builds are shipped for old

> > devices, and we expect these to gradually become less popular.

> >

> > This change sets is_high_end_android to true for arm64 builds by

> > default.

> >

> > This would make local benchmarking slightly less error prone because

> > there would be a little less to remember to set in GN args when making a

> > build for the most popular official configuration.

> >

> > Known effects:

> >

> > 1. Seemingly all official arm64 builders now explicitly set

> > is_high_end_android. Hence no effect for them.

> >

> > 2. Non-official arm64 builders will change to become high-end, even the

> > ones that end up running on old devices (example: android-arm64-rel).

> > In this patch we make sure that is_high_end_android is ignored for

> > non-official builds (disabled RELR relocations for non-official).

> > Hence, no effect here as well.

> >

> > 3. Official builds of Monochrome made by devs would fail to run on

> > Android pre-P (because RELR support is lacking). This leads to

> > mysterious crashes during something-dlopen in the Android dynamic

> > linker. Hopefully nobody does this before we remove support for

> > Android O.

> >

> > Bug: 1515925

> > Change-Id: I695c98852bb410894144452211aa06cc32ffb141

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5169071

entry.title: Avoid test timeouts from AXObjectCacheImpl::CheckTreeIsUpdated
entry.content:
When DCHECK is on, we verify the tree is correct after every update.

This verification is slow and work has been done to cap the number

of elements in large trees. Still, even with those caps, these checks

contributed to a timeout error of a test added here:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5147927



So this CL implements two other idea to continue the checks but with less overhead.

* The tree check is not run before the document is finished loading.

* The tree is now checked after the first 1-5 updates, and after that,

it is only checked, at most, every 5 seconds.



Change-Id: I8a4f2e5149d9a5d9d2e335a935675d309ce22272

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5193398

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

Reviewed-by: Joanmarie Diggs

Commit-Queue: Aaron Leventhal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1249350}

entry.title: [FedCM] Allow setting login status from a same-site request
entry.content:
This relaxes the same-origin requirement to same-site for processing

the login status header. This is useful for IDPs who process IDP

logins on a different host than the FedCM endpoint.



This is behind a default-enabled flag so we can easily disable this

in case of issues.



The virtual test suite explicitly enables the flag so that the test

will keep working in case the flag has to be turned off.



Approved by Security & Privacy in

entry.title: Ash: Don't throttle XHR requests for non-Google properties
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/1434283 migrated a utility that throttled XHR

requests to Google web properties until ChromeOS (Ash) has minted

cookies for the user. This is useful for avoiding error messages that

tell the user that they are logged out - since users are supposed to

have an SSO experience in ChromeOS.



During this migration however, the implementation was slightly changed.

The original implementation -

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1434283/5/chrome/browser/chromeos/login/signin/merge_session_resource_throttle.cc#b59

used to check if the request being throttled is a request to a Google

sub-domain. The new implementation didn't check for this -

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1434283/5/chrome/renderer/chromeos_merge_session_loader_throttle.cc#45



Fix this by filtering requests to Google sub-domains when throttling.



Bug: b/315072145

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter="*AshMergeSessionLoaderThrottleTest*"

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="*MergeSessionTimeoutTest*"

Change-Id: I6fe61a6830853eee5c817a5100efd243ff31612d

entry.title: Reland "Kcer: Split GetKeyInfo"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 02c439796393e29c28763c1272ca112cde4c6747

Fix: Updated kcer_nss_fuzzer.cc



Original change's description:

> Kcer: Split GetKeyInfo

>

> The original idea was to retrieve all the attributes at once

> because that can be done efficiently with the PKCS#11 interface.

> Unfortunately in cases when the size of attributes is not known and

> they can be missing, this doesn’t actually work well. E.g. if one

> attribute was never set and the provided buffer for another one is

> too small, the PKCS#11 interface can just return that some attributes

> are missing and then the caller has to retry with a different set

> of attributes to check that the “buffer is too small” error was

> not hidden by the “attribute is missing” one.

> So for custom attributes that are often never set it’s easier to

> retrieve them separately.

>

> Introduce GetKeyPermissions and GetCertProvisioningProfileId and

> refactor the existing code to implement them.

>

> Bug: b:287015636

> Test: *Kcer* unit tests

> Change-Id: I90f45890c49c75843fadcc487867f759db426818

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5176968

> Commit-Queue: Michael Ershov

> Reviewed-by: Pavol Marko

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248086}



Bug: b:287015636

entry.title: Use PWM predictions in the form sent in the cache request.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the PasswordManager::FormDataParser predictions were

used to decide whether a form is a login form, but were not actually

applied to the form sent in the prefill request.



This CL changes that. Since this CL has an impact on the data sent

for prefill requests, it is guarded behind a feature flag. For that,

we use the feature flag for comparison by form signature id. We will

rename the feature to something along the lines of

"UsePasswordManagerParserPredictionsForPrefillRequests" in a follow-up

CL.

entry.title: Simplify paint-order handling for SVG text and decorations
entry.content:
Add a constructor that "compress" the paint-order list by moving the

'markers' keyword to the last position. Markers are not painted for text

or decorations so will always be ignored, and this simplifies the

handling since only two actual sequences need to be considered.



For painting add one helper to resolve the paint order and one to

iterate the resolved list and dispatch to the relevant paint function.

entry.title: [ios] Use TestSessionRestorationService in GridMediatorTestClass
entry.content:
Some tests based on GridMediatorTestClass uses fake WebStates which

causes them to fail when using the SessionRestorationService version

based on the new optimised session storage (as the fake WebStates do

not implement correctly SerializeToProto).



Since those tests don't depend on serialisation, install a test

implementation of SessionRestorationService to make the independent

of the service.

entry.title: [iOS] Rename DownloadManager{TabHelper,Coordinator} methods
entry.content:
This CL renames some methods in the download manager code, as these

methods will do different things because of UI changes in Save to Drive.

As a result of these changes, the account picker presented by Save to

Drive will also let the user select "Files" as a destination for their

download, which is why some "regular" downloads need to be started from

the DownloadManagerTabHelper. As a result

- `OnDownloadAddedToSaveToDrive()` is renamed to `StartDownload()` and

- `Download()` is renamed to `SetCurrentDownload()`, since this method

effectively changes what `DownloadTask` instance is currently active

in the current tab.



Bug: 1495353

Change-Id: I09182ed6a2aa6706d9a8fc0c1a369157ac48daa4

(Layout and whether text and images can be shown together is TBC,

so just chuck it all together for now.)

creating PickerGifViews.

entry.content:

cheap to save the session after closing all tabs, so explicitly

request it.



This should ensure that for users with a large number of tabs, the

operation appears to have succeeded if they kill the app shortly

after using the "close all tabs" button.

entry.title: [//gpu] Cache SharedTextureMemory for Graphite in IOSurfaceImageBacking
entry.content:
This change creates SharedTextureMemory objects in IOSurfaceImageBacking

rather than in the Dawn representations that it creates and caches the

SharedTextureMemory object created for the Graphite device. By doing

this, we ensure that Graphite fully benefits from any internal caching

that SharedTextureMemory does (e.g., of Metal texture objects) by having

this caching be exploited across Dawn representation instances.



In the fullness of time, we will do this for SharedTextureMemory objects

associated with devices created for WebGPU as well. However, that could

currently lead to memory leakage: SharedTextureMemory holds on to a

reference for the device, and WebGPUDecoderImpl does not currently

destroy devices that it creates on its own destruction. Hence, caching

SharedTextureMemory objects for these devices could lead to memory

leakage over time (e.g., for SharedImages maintained in a client-side

pool on which WebGPU is used repeatedly). crbug.com/1515822 must first

be resolved.



Bug: 1493854

Change-Id: I5403e13a5ca71a49aa2dcbe9d7443efe2c5070b9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5182876

Reviewed-by: Austin Eng

Commit-Queue: Colin Blundell

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1249275}

entry.title: [//media] Convert SI RASTER usage to RASTER_READ | RASTER_WRITE
entry.content:
There are no functional changes, as RASTER is a constant that expands

to RASTER_READ | RASTER_WRITE. This will allow us to subsequently (1)

eliminate RASTER and (2) refine all RASTER_READ | RASTER_WRITE usage

based on where raster reads and writes are actually necessary.

entry.title: Fix bug with FreeSlotBitmapReset called with range within cell
entry.content:
FreeSlotBitmapReset's DCHECK validation was looking at irrelevant bits

when the given memory range was within a cell.



When the range is within a cell is handled by

`if (begin_cell == end_cell)` block so it should return there.

entry.title: [Shortstand] Update effective display mode when shortstand enabled.
entry.content:
When shortstand is enabled, and it decided a web app is not a shortcut,

and user display mode is kBrowser, the override app display mode

was being ignored. This CL properly integrates shortstand into the

ResolveEffectiveDisplayMode() to get the correct display mode when

the app is in a window.



In addition to that, with shortstand enabled, the kTabbed user display

mode will no longer have any effects, the UI has already been removed

from previous CL because this was a developer testing only feature.



Design doc: go/shortstand-dd#bookmark=id.ytk385j7mogp



BUG=b/320812965

entry.title: [PA] Use "Internal Partition" in *Scan
entry.content:
`ThreadCache`, Lightweight Quarantine and PCScan is using heap allocated

memory from Partition Allocator to manage their internal metadata.

Using the default partition for these data can result in reentrancy

issues.

This CL uses "Internal Partition" defined in the parent CL and forward

allocations for *Scan to the new partition.



Change-Id: Ic78c70fd5a9a0033812371bda379ff77f958368d

entry.title: [siso] Exclude stamp files from clang compile inputs
entry.content:
Siso/Reproxy's remote compile actions are slightly different from

Ninja/Reclient's remote compiles.

Including *.inputdeps.stamp is one of the reasons.

This makes Siso CQ experiments unfair in terms of cache hits.



This CL excludes *.stamp files from clang compile as they aren't

necessary.

entry.title: p13n: SeaPen send ImageDimensions
entry.content:
Remove ImageResolution and AspectRatio and only send

ImageDimensions. This allows more flexibility in requesting

sizes / aspect ratios on the server.



ImageDimensions is set to 880x440 for thumbnails, and set to

the size of the current largest display for full size images.

If the current largest display is in portrait orientation, swap

the dimensions to always request landscape. Portrait mode will

be supported later.



Bug: b:320496706

entry.title: Reland "Automated T* -> raw_ptr<T> rewrite 'refresh'"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d23c94321e2367736cafdaf0395782c97e775af7.



Retrying based on gpu-fyi-try-mac-nvidia-retina-rel passing and

http://crbug/1518884#c7 that suggests that CI has been seen passing

even before the revert.



Original change's description:

> Automated T* -> raw_ptr rewrite "refresh"

>

> PS1: automated rewrite

> PS2-PS5,PS7: unrewrite to fix compilation

> PS6,PS22: unrewrite non-automated exclusions

> PS8-PS20: apply DanglingUntriaged

> PS21: unrewrite to undo binary size increase

> PS23: remove no-longer-needed RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION, #includes & comments

>

> The code has changed since the "big rewrite" so some exclusions no

> longer apply. But also, the rewriter changed too:

> - No longer applies constexpr-related exclusions (raw_ptr<> support

> was added)

> - union exclusion has been waived for std::optional and absl::variant,

> since they invoke raw_ptr<>'s ctor/dtor correctly

> - Certain paths under //base are no longer need to be excluded, as

> PartitionAlloc/raw_ptr no longer depends on them

>

> This CL also tries to popularize a better format of exclusion reasoning

> comments, e.g.:

> // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: #addr-of, #global-scope

> // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: Performance reasons ...

> // RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION: #addr-of; Also: Another reason

> One comment per block of fields will suffice, if the reason is the

> same throughout, and no other comments are added in between.

> This format has advantages, like brevity (no more "not a raw_ptr<>

> because" blurb), and improved scriptability.

>

> Bug: 1446392

> Change-Id: I784ff0e461b2105bc01ad7b8570bb462613b24ce

> DanglingUntriaged-notes: automated rewrite.

> AX-Relnotes: n/a.

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5190661

> Reviewed-by: Keishi Hattori

entry.title: Disallow multiple declarative roots and mismatched imperative ones
entry.content:
Two changes:

1. If two declarative shadow roots are included within a single

host element, only the *first* one will remain. This is a

change in behavior from before, but reached consensus [1]

and hopefully won't be a breaking change for anyone.

2. If attachShadow() is used on an existing declarative shadow

root, and the parameters (e.g. shadow root type, etc.) do

not match, an exception is thrown. This, also, is a breaking

change, but hopefully not one that gets hit. See also [1].



See [2] and [3] for the corresponding spec PRs.



[1] https://github.com/whatwg/dom/issues/1235

[2] https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10069

[3] https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1246



Bug: 1379513,1042130

entry.title: Reland "flags: don't rewrite generated expired list unnecessarily"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit e303a4a62b466fcb9771f2f0490601ef0eed0fff



Original change's description:

> flags: don't rewrite generated expired list unnecessarily

>

> If someone changes the milestone of an unexpired flag in the flag

> metadata file, or changes a comment or similar, the generated C++ file

> doesn't change, but the tool currently rewrites it anyway. This updates

> the mtime on it and causes a rebuild of the targets that depend on it.

>

> To avoid that, have the tool only rewrite the generated C++ file if

> there are actual changes to its contents.

>

> To test this:

> $ touch chrome/browser/flag-metadata.json

> $ ninja -v -C $OUTDIR chrome

>

> Before this change, you'll see several targets rebuilt; afterwards

> you'll just see this script running. You can also edit an expired flag

> to have a different expiry milestone and see that in that situation the

> script does still rewrite the file. I did not write an automated test

> for this behavior because it's annoying to write a portable, non-flaky

> test that messes with mtimes and such.

>

> Fixed: 1518423

> Change-Id: I057111cb55cb88b0eb17e09ea419e76fd178a5ac

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5213225

> Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

> Commit-Queue: Alexei Svitkine

> Auto-Submit: Elly FJ

> Commit-Queue: Elly FJ

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248997}



Change-Id: Ie70da744ac42a8955eb95d01f374cb5fbe88bfde

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5214805
